Book Your Room Now!!Simple Introduction of AustriaAustria, officially the Republic of Austria, is a federal republic and a landlocked country of roughly 8.47 million people in Central Europe.TOP Tourist Attractions / Point of Interest of Austria1. Melk Abbey - one of the most famous monasteries in the world2. Vienna State Opera - the orchestra is recognized as one of the top in the world3. Seefeld, Tyrol - is an important cross-country skiing center with terrain that is compatible for beginner and intermediate skiers.4. Hohensalzburg Castle - one of the largest and most well-preserve medieval castles in Europe.5. Hofburg Imperial Palace - the official residence of the President of Austria.6. Innsbruck Altstadt 7. St Anton am Arlberg - another famous ski resort area.8. Grossglockner Alpine Road - provide the unobstructed view of Austria's highest mountain, the Grossglockner.9. Hallstatt in Salzkammergut region - famous for its salt production.10. Schonbrunn Palace in Vienna11. Old view of the Basilica Mariazell12. Great Ferris Wheel Prater in Vienna13. Belvedere Palace14. Schlossberg Graz with Clock Tower - landmark of Graz.15. Swarovski Crystal Worlds 16. Museum of Fine Arts at Ringstrasse17. Salzburg Dom, Salzburg18. The Ring in Vienna19. Art Gallery in Vienna20. Karlskirche in Vienna21. National Theather in Vienna22. Hallein in Salzburg23. Stodertal in Salzburg24. Tomb and Museum of Emperor Maximilian I in Salzburg25. Linz Schloss in Linz26. Kremunster in Linz
